meanings.definition: To row faster than others in a race.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, Sarah was outrowing her opponents effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The rowing team practiced hard to improve their outrowing skills.
meanings.sent3: The turtle challenged the hare to a rowing race, confident in its outrowing abilities.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outrow her previous time was like a strong current pushing her forward.
meanings.sent5: The image of the rower outrowing the strong waves stayed with him as a symbol of perseverance.

meanings.definition: The act of rowing faster than others in a race.
meanings.sent1: His outrowing in the regatta earned him a gold medal.
meanings.sent2: The outrowing of the team secured their victory in the championship.
meanings.sent3: The spectators cheered loudly as they witnessed the impressive outrowing of the young rower.
meanings.sent4: The outrowing of the canoe in the swift river was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The outrowing competition brought out the best in all the participants.
